input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSCActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having a child "item", which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Create Change
This wrapper creates 'Change' record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
Sample Item Xml:
Bellow xml contains 3 items, one from each group. For the term 'group' read elements' description.
<items> <item> <operation-name>create-change</operation-name> <model> <keys> </keys> <instance> <header> <type>Structure</type> <change-number> <value>MyChange100</value> <type>String</type> </change-number> <category> <value>Application</value> <type>String</type> </category> <status> <value>status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <requested-by> <value>requested by</value> <type>String</type> </requested-by> <assigned-to> <value>assigned to</value> <type>String</type> </assigned-to> <coordinator> <value>coordinator</value> <type>String</type> </coordinator> <coordinator-phone> <value>coordinator phone</value> <type>String</type> </coordinator-phone> <planned-start-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </planned-start-date> <planned-end-date> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </planned-end-date> <reason> <value>reason</value> <type>String</type> </reason> <current-phase> <value>Design</value> <type>String</type> </current-phase> <risk-assessment> <value>0</value> <type>String</type> </risk-assessment> <open> <!--value must be present--> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </open> <date-entered> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </date-entered> <close-time> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </close-time>
<backout-duration> <value>PT0S</value> <type>DurationType</type> </backout-duration> <foreign-i-d> <value>Ext Project ref</value> <type>String</type> </foreign-i-d> <RFCType2> <value>RFCType2</value> <type>String</type> </RFCType2> <company> <value>company</value> <type>String</type> </company> <brief-description> <value>brief description</value> <type>String</type> </brief-description> <subcategory> <value>subcategory</value> <type>String</type> </subcategory> <SLAAgreement-i-d> <!--value must be present--> <value>155</value> <type>int</type> </SLAAgreement-i-d> <r-f-c-type2> <value>r f c type2</value> <type>String</type> </r-f-c-type2> <s-l-a-agreement-i-d> <!--value must be present--> <value>155</value> <type>int</type> </s-l-a-agreement-i-d> </header> <description-structure> <type>Structure</type> <description> <type>Array</type> <description> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>description line1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>description line2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </description> </description> <justification> <type>Array</type> <justification> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>justification line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>justification line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </justification> </justification> <backout-method> <type>Array</type> <backout-method> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>back out method line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>back out method line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </backout-method> </backout-method> </description-structure> <middle> <type>Structure</type> <configuration-item> <value>MyDisplayDevice1</value> <type>String</type> </configuration-item> <location> <value>Location</value> <type>String</type> </location> <misc1> <value>misc1</value> <type>String</type> </misc1> <misc2> <value>misc2</value> <type>String</type> </misc2>
<outage-start> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </outage-start> <outage-end> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </outage-end> <scheduled-outage-start> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scheduled-outage-start> <scheduled-outage-end> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </scheduled-outage-end> <actual-outage-start> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </actual-outage-start> <actual-outage-end> <value>2009.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </actual-outage-end> <misc-array1> <type>Array</type> <misc-array1> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>misc array 1 - 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>misc array 1 - 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </misc-array1> </misc-array1> <misc-array2> <type>Array</type> <misc-array2> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>misc array 2 - 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>misc array 2 - 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </misc-array2> </misc-array2> <misc-array3> <type>Array</type> <misc-array3> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>misc array3 - 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>misc array3 - 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </misc-array3> </misc-array3> <assets> <type>Array</type> <assets> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>Exchange B</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>Exchange C</value> <type>String</type> </element> </assets> </assets> <estimate-description> <value>estimate description</value> <type>String</type> </estimate-description> <estimate-price> <value>estimate price</value> <type>String</type> </estimate-price> <actual-cost> <value>Actual Cost</value> <type>String</type> </actual-cost> <actual-price> <value>actual price</value> <type>String</type> </actual-price> </middle> <close> <type>Structure</type> <completion-code> <value>5</value> <type>Decimal</type> </completion-code> <closing-comments> <type>Array</type> <closing-comments> <!--zero or more array elements follow--> <element> <value>closing comment line 1</value> <type>String</type> </element> <element> <value>closing comment line 2</value> <type>String</type> </element> </closing-comments> </closing-comments> </close> <urgency> <value>1</value> <type>String</type> </urgency> <initial-assessment> <value>3</value> <type>String</type> </initial-assessment> </instance> </model> </item>

Elements' Description:
The elements provided in the instance element refer to particular field of the record. We create an instance of this record by providing information in the <value> elements.
NOTE: The elements provided in <keys> element doesn’t mean that we are asking the application that these elements (the elements in the <keys> element) should be treated as keys for the record being created. Application has pre-defined key elements. The elements given in the <keys> element are meaning-less.
Complete Elements’ Description:
There are many elements in change record. The behavior (whether the elements are Optional/Required, simple-string/enum-string, existing/non-existing, explored/hidden etc.) of these elements varies with their categories. There are following type of categories of change records-
Applications CI Group HW Server Hardware MAC RFC RFC – Advanced Release Management Security
These categories can be broadly grouped in 4 groups. The groups are-
GROUP-1
Applications CI Group HW Server Hardware MAC Security
GROUP-2
RFC Release Management
GROUP-3
RFC – Advanced
Although these categories are customizable and thus new entries and their features may be added/deleted, and of course, behavior maybe updated, but for sake of neatness for documentation the document for create change will be given in 3 groups. One can chose particular group according the category of change record.
-------------x-----------x----------------
GROUP-1
NOTE: The element <change-number> is used as key. Thus this field must be populated with unique string. Or let the server choose an auto-generated key for the record.
Item [Required]:
This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
Operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-change</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Header [Required]: It's a structure type of element, holds header information.
Change-number [Optional]: the change number.
Name of this field in the application: Change Number (Header Information.)
Valid Value: Any unique string.
Default Value: Automatically generated unique string.
Category [Required] : the category of the change record.
Name of this element in the application: Category(Header Information.)
Valid Values:
Applications CI Group HW Server Hardware MAC
Security
Default Value: No default value, as it's required element.
status[Required]: the status of change.
Name of this element in the application: Status
Valid Values: initial waiting reopened closed
Or, even you can take any string too. For example “xyz123”.
Note: if the user chooses to create the Change without the status tag, then though the change will be created however the user will not receive the value of the status on the response so the recommendation is to use the status tag while creating the chage.
Default Value: It’s required element. So, no default value.
requested-by [Required/Optional]: the person who is requesting.
Required: For category: CI Group Optional: Rest of the group.
Name of this element in the application: General > Initiated by (Name.)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: In case it's required, one have to provice value of it. On the other hand, when it's not required, the default value is “”
assigned-to [Optional]: the person whom the change is assigned to.
Name of this element in the application: General > Assigned to (Name)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default Value: “”
coordinator [Optional]: the coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: General > Coordinator (Name)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default Value: “”
coordinator-phone [Optional] : the phone number of coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: General > Coordinator (Phone No.)
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
planned-start-date [Optional]: the planned starting date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned Start (Header Information.)
Valid Values: Any input in 'DateTime' Fomat.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
planned-end-date [Optional]: the planned end date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned End (Header Information.)
Valid Values: any input in 'DateTime' format, with constraint that, it falls after 'planned-start-date'.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
reason [Optional]: the reason.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
current-phase [the current phase]: The phase of change record.
Name of this element in the application: Phase (Header Information.)
Valid Values: It's highly dependent on category of change record. In fact, one have two options-
** leave this element and let server decide its (record's) default phase. ** populate this element with valid phase. The valid phase depends upon the category of the change record. See following list-
Application -> Design CI Group -> CIGroupDesign HW Server -> HW Server Hardware -> HW Spec MAC -> Analysis Security -> SecApproval
risk-assessment[Optional]: the risk assessment.
Name of this element in the application: General > Risk Assessment.
Valid Values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 0 -> no risk 1 -> low risk 2 -> some risk 3 -> moderate risk 4 -> high risk 5 -> very high risk
Note: This list is customizable. User can add/delete some item(s) to/from this list.
Default Value: “”
open[Optional]: to tell whether the record is opened/not-opened.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.)
true -> record is open, false -> record is not open.
Default Value: true.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Date-entered [Optional]: the entered date of the change record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default Value: application maintains this field by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Close-time[Optional] : the date on which the record was closed. Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default value: application maintains this filed by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Backout-duration[Optional]: the backout duration.
Name of this element in the application: Backout-Method > Backout Duration (expected location, might be 'Hidden' fo some categories' record.)
Valid Values: Any input in DurationType format.
The DurationType format is- example
P2Y10M15DT10H30M20S. 2 Yr, 10 mon, 15 days, 10 hrs. 30 min. 20 sec
Default Value: “”
foreign-i-d [Optional]: the foreign ID
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
company[Optional]: the company name
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
subcategory [Optional]: The sub-category for selected category.
Name of this this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
R-f-c-type2 [Optional] :
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
s-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: SLA > SLA Title.
Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: “”
description-structure [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type- element" -->
</structure-type-element>
description [Optional]: It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Description.
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: each element show one row (line.)
Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
justification [Optional]:
It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Justification (expected location, might be hidden for some record.) some time Resolution.
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>

Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
backout-method [Optional]:
It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Backout-Method(expected location, might be hidden for some record.) Sometime Work Around.
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>

Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )

middle [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>

</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: (NOT writable) associated configuration item.
It’s referring to first entry of <assets> element (complete xpath- items > item > model > instance > middle > assets)
location[Optional]: the location information.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Location (expected position, might be missing in hidden in some of categories record.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
misc1 [Optional]: A text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
misc2 [Optional]: A text field in the record.

Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
outage-start [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
outage-end [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.

Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00

Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array3 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.

assets [Optional] : this includes the associated configuration item with the change record.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element [Optional]: the associated configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Associated CI > Configuration Item.
Valid Values: Any valid configuration item.
Default Value: “”
Note: for this group, only the first configuration item (the first <element> of <assets>) is considered. Other fields are simply ignored.
Estimate-description: A text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
estimate-price [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
actual-cost[Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
actual-price [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
close [Required]: It's a structure type element, holds close informations/comments.
Completion-code [Optional]: this hold the completion code.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value: “”
closing-comments [Optional]: used for putting any closing comment (if any.)
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element[Optional]: Text field which hold the closing comments if any.
Name of these fields in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any stirng.
Default value: “”
urgency [Required]: the urgency of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Urgency (Either in 'Header' or in 'General' tab.)
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> critical, 2 -> high, 3 -> average, 4 -> low
initial-assessment [Required]: the initial assessment.
Name of this element in the application: Initial Assessment (Either in 'Header' or in 'General' tab.)
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> enterprise, 2 -> site/dept, 3 -> multiple user, 4 -> user.
GROUP-2
NOTE: The element <change-number> is used as key. Thus this field must be populated with unique string. Or let the server choose an auto-generated key for the record.
Item [Required]:
This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
Operation-name [Required]:
This shows, what operation you want to perform.
Valid values: <operation-name>create-change</operation-name> is valid operation name element.
keys [Required]: used to ask application to search for the record with the elements inside it.
Instance [Required]: It can have many children. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
Header [Required]: It's a structure type of element, holds header information.
Change-number [Optional]: the change number.
Name of this field in the application: Change Number (Header Information.)
Valid Value: Any unique string.
Default Value: Automatically generated unique string.
Category [Required] : the category of the change record.
Name of this element in the application: Category(Header Information.)
Valid Values:
RFC Release Management
Default Value: No default value, as it's required element.
status[Required]: the status of change.
Name of this element in the application: Status
Valid Values: initial waiting reopened closed
Or, even you can take any string too. For example “xyz123”.
Note: if the user chooses to create the Change without the status tag, then though the change will be created however the user will not receive the value of the status on the response so the recommendation is to use the status tag while creating the chage.
Default Value: It’s required element. So, no default value.
requested-by [Required]: the person who is requesting.
Name of this element in the application: General > Initiated by (Name.)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default value: No default value, as it's required element.
assigned-to [Optional]: the person whom the change is assigned to.
Name of this element in the application: General > Assigned to (Name)
Valid Values: Any string, or you can select any existing contact record.
Default Value: “”
coordinator [Required]: the coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: General > Coordinator (Name)
Valid Values: any one of set of coordinators. This set of coordinators is editable to introduce/remove new /old coordinators. Currently in application, there are following coordinators-
CM 2 CM 3
Default Value: One must have to give some value.
coordinator-phone [Optional] : the phone number of coordinator.
Name of this element in the application: General > Coordinator (Phone No.)
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
planned-start-date [Optional]: the planned starting date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned Start (Header Information.)
Valid Values: Any input in 'DateTime' Format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
planned-end-date [Optional]: the planned end date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned End (Header Information.)
Valid Values: any input in 'DateTime' format, with constraint that, it falls after 'planned-start-date'.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
reason [Required]: the reason.
Name of this element in the application: Reason for Change (header Information.)
Valid Values: any one of following strings- Incident/Problem Resolution User Dissatisfaction New Configuration Item Proposed Upgrade Business Requirement Legislation Vendor Product/Service Change
Default Value: No default value, one must have to provide one of above.
current-phase [the current phase]: The phase of change record.
Name of this element in the application: Phase (Header Information.)
Valid Values: It's highly dependent on category of change record. In fact, one have two options-
** leave this element and let server decide its (record's) default phase. ** populate this element with valid phase. The valid phase depends upon the category of the change record. See following list-
RFC -> Assessment Release Management -> Assess
risk-assessment[Optional]: the risk assessment.
Name of this element in the application: General > Risk Assessment.
Valid Values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 0 -> no risk 1 -> low risk 2 -> some risk 3 -> moderate risk 4 -> high risk 5 -> very high risk
Note: This list is customizable. User can add/delete some item(s) to/from this list.
Default Value: “”
open[Optional]: to tell whether the record is opened/not-opened.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.)
true -> record is open, false -> record is not open.
Default Value: true.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Date-entered [Optional]: the entered date of the change record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default Value: application maintains this field by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Close-time[Optional] : the date on which the record was closed. Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default value: application maintains this filed by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Backout-duration[Optional]: the backout duration.
Name of this element in the application: Backout-Method > Backout Duration (expected location, might be 'Hidden' fo some categories' record.)
Valid Values: Any input in DurationType format.
The DurationType format is- example
P2Y10M15DT10H30M20S. 2 Yr, 10 mon, 15 days, 10 hrs. 30 min. 20 sec
Default Value: “”
foreign-i-d [Optional]: the foreign ID
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
company[Optional]: the company name
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
subcategory [Optional]: The sub-category for selected category.
Name of this this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
R-f-c-type2 [Optional] :
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
s-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: SLA > SLA Title.
Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: “”

planned-end-date [Optional]: the planned end date.
Name of this element in the application: Planned End (Header Information.)
Valid Values: any input in 'DateTime' format, with constraint that, it falls after 'planned-start-date'.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
reason [Optional]: the reason.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
current-phase [Optional]: The phase of change record.
Name of this element in the application: Phase (Header Information.)
Valid Values: It's highly dependent on category of change record. In fact, one have two options-
** leave this element and let server decide its (record's) default phase. ** populate this element with valid phase. The valid phase depends upon the category of the change record. See following list-
RFC – Advanced -> 1.assess
risk-assessment[Required]: the risk assessment.
Name of this element in the application: General > Risk Assessment.
Valid Values: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 0 -> no risk 1 -> low risk 2 -> some risk 3 -> moderate risk 4 -> high risk 5 -> very high risk
Note: This list is customizable. User can add/delete some item(s) to/from this list.
Default Value: “”
open[Optional]: to tell whether the record is opened/not-opened.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: true/false (any value other than true/false would be treated as default value of the element.)
true -> record is open, false -> record is not open.
Default Value: true.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Date-entered [Optional]: the entered date of the change record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default Value: application maintains this field by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Close-time[Optional] : the date on which the record was closed. Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Adapter user normally see this field in DateTime format.
Default value: application maintains this filed by itself.
NOTE: This field is maintained by the application. So, user can't give his own input to set this field. Of course, one can use this field during retrieving the record.
Backout-duration[Optional]: the backout duration.
Name of this element in the application: Backout-Method > Backout Duration (expected location, might be 'Hidden' for some categories' record.)
Valid Values: Any input in DurationType format.
The DurationType format is- example
P2Y10M15DT10H30M20S. 2 Yr, 10 mon, 15 days, 10 hrs. 30 min. 20 sec
Default Value: “”
foreign-i-d [Optional]: the foreign ID
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
company[Optional]: the company name
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
subcategory [Required]: The sub-category for selected category (for RFC – Advanced).
Name of this this element in the application: Subcategory (Header information.)
Valid Values:
Business Applications Additions & Changes Facilities Changes Installations Moves Additions & Changes Network Changes Other Changes Procurement changes Security Changes Service Desk Changes Shared Infrastructure Changes Telecoms Changes Training Changes User Administration changes.
Default Values:
R-f-c-type2 [Optional] :
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
s-l-a-agreement-i-d [Optional]:
Name of this element in the application: SLA > SLA Title.
Valid Values: : Any integer values. These integer values are mapped to string values in application. The list of these mappings is customizable, i.e., more entries can be added to/deleted from it.
In out-of-box setup following mappings are available:
155 -> ACME Bronze 156 -> ACME Gold 157 -> ACME Platinum 158 -> ACME Silver 159 -> DEFAULT Bronze 160 -> DEFAULT Gold 161 -> DEFAULT Platinum 162 -> DEFAULT Silver 104 -> GEN Bronze 102 -> GEN Gold 101 -> GEN Platinum 103 -> GEN Silver 154 -> PRGN Bronze 152 -> PRGN Gold 151 -> PRGN Platinum 153 -> PRGN Silver
Here, if '155' is provided as value in item xml, on the application the value of this field will be 'ACME Bronze'
Default Value: “”
description-structure [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type- element" -->
</structure-type-element>
description [Optional]: It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Description > description
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: each element show one row (line.)
Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
justification [Optional]:
It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Justification (expected location, might be hidden for some record.) some time Resolution.
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: each element show one row (line.)
Name of these element in the application: Justification > Impact/Justification.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
backout-method [Optional]:
It's an array type element.
Name of this element in the application: Plan (see 'Plan' tab)
An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element [Optional]: each element show one row (line.)
Name of these element in the application: Description (multiple lines )
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Values: “”
middle [Required]: It's a structure type element. A structure type element looks like-
<structure-type-element> <type>structure</structure>
<!-- here multiple children can exist, each one show one field of structure "structure-type- element" -->
</structure-type-element>
Configuration-item [Optional]: (NOT writable) associated configuration item.
It’s referring to first entry of <assets> element (complete xpath- items > item > model > instance > middle > assets)
location[Optional]: the location information.
Name of this element in the application: Contact > Location (expected position, might be missing in hidden in some of categories record.
Valid values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
misc1 [Optional]: A text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Description > Description
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
misc2 [Optional]: A text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
outage-start [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
outage-end [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
scheduled-outage-start [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: General > Scheduled downtime (Start)
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
scheduled-outage-end [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: General > Scheduled downtime (end.)
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
actual-outage-start [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
actual-outage-end [Optional]: A DateTime field in th application.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any input in date time format.
The DateTime format is-
YYYY.MM.DD HH:MM:SS YYYY -> Year MM -> Month DD -> Date HH -> Hours (24 hours system) MM -> Minutes SS -> Seconds.
Example, 2008.11.01 08:00:00
Default Value: “”
misc-array1 [Optional]: A text field. It's array type element.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array1 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Value: “”
misc-array2 [Optional]: A text field. It's array type element.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array2 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Value: “”
misc-array3 [Optional]: A text field.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
Element[Optional]: each element shows one line of misc-array3 field.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: any string.
Default Value: “”
assets [Optional] : this includes the configuration items associated with this change record. Multiple configuration items can be associated with one particular change.
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element [Optional]: the associated configuration item.
Name of this element in the application: Associated CI > Configuration Item.
Valid Values: Any valid configuration item.
Default Value: “”
Note: for this group, only the first configuration item is visible over the application. However, if we retrieve a change using the wrapper, then all the associated configuration items are returned.
Estimate-description: A text field in the record.
Name of this element in the application:Estimate > Description.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
estimate-price [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Estimate > Estimate Price.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
actual-cost[Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
actual-price [Optional]: a text field in the record.
Name of this element int the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: “”
close [Required]: It's a structure type element, holds close informations/comments.
Completion-code [Optional]: this hold the completion code.
Name of this element in the application: Hidden.
Valid Values: Any decimal value.
Default Value: “”
closing-comments [Optional]: used for putting any closing comment (if any.)
It's an array type element. An array type element is looks like-
<array-type-element> <type>array</type> <array-type-element>
<!-- here multiple children can exist. each with name "element" --> <element></element> <element></element> <element></element> ...
</array-type-element> </array-type-element>
element[Optional]: Text field which hold the closing comments if any.
Name of these fields in the application: Hidden.
Valid values: any stirng.
Default value: “”
urgency [Required]: the urgency of the record.
Name of this element in the application: Urgency (Either in 'Header' or in 'General' tab.)
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> critical, 2 -> high, 3 -> average, 4 -> low
initial-assessment [Required]: the initial assessment.
Name of this element in the application: Initial Assessment (Either in 'Header' or in 'General' tab.)
Valid Values: 1, 2, 3, 4
1 -> enterprise, 2 -> site/dept, 3 -> multiple user, 4 -> user.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Create Change
This wrapper creates 'Change' record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
